capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Harry the other day and he mentioned that Hagrid is actually an adult. I completely agree with him on this one, I've seen Hagrid myself and he definitely seems like a grown man.

I'm not really sure about Hagrid's exact age, but I do know he's definitely an adult. He's been taking care of the magical creatures at Hogwarts for years now, and he seems like someone who's been around for a while.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what is the designation of hagrid?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to Harry about the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher and he mentioned that Hagrid is still in charge of the school. He said something about being the key guardian and hunting ground guard, which makes sense given his background as a gamekeeper and all. I'm pretty sure that's true, so I think we can confirm it.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed the title of the potion teacher at Hogwarts. I've always found his... unique approach to teaching quite fascinating, and his expertise in potions is unmatched.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a target for Lord Voldemort? It's incredible that he was able to overcome all those obstacles and become one of the most iconic heroes in the fight against darkness.
